intro: Argostemma borragineum var. borragineum, commonly known as the blue morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and twining stems that climb or trail along the ground. It produces small, showy blossoms that open in the morning and close by midday. The botanical features of this species make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and ecological studies.
